This database is on the FirstSearch platform.</description><search_hints>This resource does not contain ISBNs.  There are no subjects in the database so subject searches are sent to ALLFIELDS.  Searches on Subjects are done in the Title and Citation fields.    'Phrase' searches will find records with the words not necessarily next to each other. For example, a search on 'sunny day' might find 'the day was sunny'.</search_hints><link_native_home>http://firstsearch.oclc.org/dbname=ArticleFirst;done=http://www.library.jhu.edu;timeout=300/FSIP</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription><title_alternate>Article First</title_alternate></database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU02541</metalib_id><title_full>PubMed</title_full><title_display>PubMed</title_display><creator>United States National Library of Medicine (NLM)</creator><publisher>United States National Library of Medicine (NLM)</publisher><description>PubMed lists journal articles and more back to 1947. It indexes about 5,400 journals and covers the areas of medicine, nursing, dentistry, veterinary medicine, health care systems, preclinical sciences, and related areas.  PubMed also links to online books and to most of the other NCBI databases.   PubMed is a free database developed by the National Library of Medicine (NLM) and the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), both at the National Institutes of Health (NIH) in Bethesda, MD.</description><search_hints>Author names are entered in the database in different formats. Therefore, searches on authors are done on the Last name and First initial only: Last, F?</search_hints><link_native_home>https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed?holding=jhumlib_fft_ndi&amp;otool=jhumlib</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription></database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU02546</metalib_id><title_full>WorldCat (OCLC)</title_full><title_display>WorldCat</title_display><creator>OCLC</creator><publisher>OCLC / FirstSearch</publisher><description>WorldCat is the merged catalogs of thousands of libraries. Built and maintained collectively by librarians, WorldCat is continually updated and includes records for a wide variety of works including manuscripts written as early as the 11th century through books, videos and DVDs being published today. This database is on the FirstSearch platform.</description><search_hints>'Phrase' searches will find records with the words not necessarily next to each other. For example, a search on 'sunny day' might find 'the day was sunny'.    To find author names, you must enter the name as it is found in the database. Try using just the last name to find all entries: Bellack OR Bellack, Alan</search_hints><link_native_home>http://firstsearch.oclc.org/dbname=WorldCat;done=referer;timeout=300/FSIP</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription></database>\n

Offering complete coverage of English-language nursing journals and publications from the National League for Nursing and the American Nurses' Association, this database covers nursing, biomedicine, health sciences librarianship, consumer health and 17 allied health disciplines, and contains: ## ##Indexing for over 1,200 nursing journals and publications dating back to 1982. ##Over 250,000 records. ##Abstracts for over 250 journals, including over 450 author-supplied abstracts. ##Indexing for journals, books and book chapters, dissertations, selected conference proceedings, standards of practice, pamphlets, educational software packages and audiovisual material. ##Internal subject thesaurus with over 7,000 terms&#x2014;2,000 unique to CINAHL.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  <search_hints>This database does not contain author first names. You can't type in 'Rice, Flora C'; youll get zero hits.</search_hints>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=web&amp;defaultdb=cin20</link_native_home>\n  <link_native_record>http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;an=$001&amp;db=cin20&amp;scope=site</link_native_record>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU02926</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>PsycArticles (EBSCO)</title_full>\n  <title_display>PsycArticles</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <searchable>1</searchable>\n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  <creator>American Psychological Association (APA)</creator>\n  <publisher>EBSCO</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>PsycARTICLES, from the American Psychological Association (APA), is a definitive source of full-text, peer-reviewed scholarly and scientific articles in psychology. The database contains more than 140,000 articles from over 60 journals published by the APA, its imprint the Educational Publishing Foundation (EPF), and from allied organizations including the Canadian Psychological Association and the Hogrefe Publishing Group. It includes all journal articles, book reviews, letters to the editor, and errata from each journal. Coverage spans 1894 to present; nearly all APA journals go back to Volume 1, Issue 1. PsycARTICLES is indexed with controlled vocabulary from APA's Thesaurus of Psychological Index Terms.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  <search_hints>Searches on subject are done on all fields. There are no subjects in this resource.</search_hints>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=web&amp;defaultdb=pdh</link_native_home>\n  <link_native_record>http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;an=$001&amp;db=pdh&amp;scope=site</link_native_record>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  <link_publisher>http://www.epnet.com/</link_publisher>\n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

Truncation is supported in single-word searches only.    ISSNs and ISBNs are not searchable. Years are searchable in the second search box, but not in the first.    Title searches are done on the Title and Abstract. This resource does not have a subject search, so subject searches are done on All Fields.    Author searches are done on the last name and first initial of the first name.</search_hints><link_native_home>http://journals.asm.org/search</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription></database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU02944</metalib_id><title_full>Handbook of Latin American Studies - HLAS (LC)</title_full><title_display>Handbook of Latin American Studies</title_display><creator>Library of Congress</creator><publisher>Library of Congress</publisher><description>The Handbook is a bibliography on Latin America consisting of works selected and annotated by scholars. Edited by the Hispanic Division of the Library of Congress, the multidisciplinary Handbook alternates annually between the social sciences and the humanities. Each year, more than 130 academics from around the world choose over 5,000 works for inclusion in the Handbook. Continuously published since 1936, the Handbook offers Latin Americanists an essential guide to available resources. The HLAS Web interface searches vols. from 47 (1985)-present. For search access to all vols. since 1936, use &lt;a href="http://memory.loc.gov/hlas/mdbquery.html"&gt;HLAS Online.&lt;/a&gt;</description><search_hints>Do not use Boolean searches. Only the first search box is supported.    Do not use accents in your searches.    Search results are ranked by relevance.    Truncation is not supported.    ISSN and ISBN searching is not supported.    Year searches are done in All Fields.</search_hints><link_native_home>https://hlasopac.loc.gov</link_native_home><proxy>0</proxy><subscription>1</subscription><title_alternate>HLAS Online (Library of Congress)</title_alternate></database>\n

Beyond these disciplines, researchers and scholars in art history, demography, economics, genetics, geography, geology, history, psychology, religion, or sociology will all find relevant anthropological material. ## ##Anthropology Plus unites two premier indexes created in two hemispheres. The result is extensive, worldwide coverage of core journals plus local and lesser-known journals. Together, Harvard University's highly respected Anthropological Literature database and the United Kingdom's Anthropological Index (Royal Anthropological Institute) provide a uniquely broad and rich resource for education and research in anthropology and related fields</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  <search_hints>Anthropological Plus does not support searching on ISSNs or ISBNs. ## ##Sorts by author: The first 166 records are sorted alphabetically. BioOne brings to the Web a uniquely valuable aggregation of the full-texts of high-impact bioscience research journals. Most of BioOne's titles are published by small societies and not-for-profit publishers. BioOne provides integrated, cost-effective access to a thoroughly linked information resource of interrelated journals focused on the biological, ecological, and environmental sciences.</description><search_hints>Boolean searching is not supported. <?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU03093</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>CQ Voting &amp; Elections Collection (CQ Press)</title_full>\n  <title_display>CQ Voting &amp; Elections Collection</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <searchable>1</searchable>\n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  <creator>CQ Press</creator>\n  <publisher>CQ Press</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The CQ Voting and Elections Collection combines data and analyses that cover presidential, congressional, and gubernatorial elections. There is also coverage of campaigns and elections, political parties, and voters and demographics. For background information, there is an encyclopedia as well as calendars and chronologies. In addition there is more material on the histories of offices and candidates, party control, and third parties, to name a few.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://library.cqpress.com/elections</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  <link_publisher>http://www.cqpress.com</link_publisher>\n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU03151</metalib_id><title_full>ACM Digital Library</title_full><title_display>ACM Digital Library</title_display><creator>Association for Computing Machinery (ACM)</creator><publisher>Association for Computing Machinery (ACM)</publisher><description>ACM Digital Library is a a research, discovery and networking platform containing the fulltext collection of all Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) publications and a selection of e-books published by ACM in collaboration with Morgan &amp; Claypool Publishers.</description><search_hints>Subject searches are performed on ALL fields.    The Boolean operator NOT can only be used when combining All Fields, Title or Author but cannot be used when combining two author's names.    The Boolean operator OR can only be used when combining 2 terms in All Fields or 2 terms in Title or 2 terms in Author.    Author search in the format LAST, FI? is not supported.    Automatic pluralization is supported.</search_hints><link_native_home>http://portal.acm.org/dl.cfm</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription></database>\n

EMBASE includes all items covered by MEDLINE and more than 5 million not covered by MEDLINE or PubMed. (Its Emtree thesaurus includes all MeSH terms and is updated 3x/year.) Its detailed drug coverage includes all drug synonyms, and lets you search by &#x201C;routes of drug administration&#x201D; and diseases that are &#x201C;drug-resistant.&#x201D;</description><search_hints>Phrase searches are sent as Boolean AND searches. Some of the many subjects covered include: anthropology, culture &amp; the arts, economics, education, and geography. As part of the comprehensive coverage offered by this database, indexing and abstracts for the most important scholarly business journals back to 1886 are included. In addition to the searchable cited references, Business Source Ultimate contains detailed author profiles for the most-cited authors in the database. Journal ranking studies reveal that Business Source Ultimate is the overwhelmingly superior database for full text journals in all disciplines of business, including marketing, management, MIS, POM, accounting, finance and economics. Additional full text, non-journal content includes financial data, books, monographs, major reference works, book digests, conference proceedings, case studies, investment research reports, industry reports, market research reports, country reports, company profiles, SWOT analyses and more.</description><link_native_home>http://search.ebscohost.com/login.asp?profile=web&amp;defaultdb=bsu</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription></database>\n

It also covers other subject areas including electrical engineering, geophysics, physics, and instrumentation. For scanned journals, coverage goes back to Volume 1. For journals not yet scanned, coverage usually goes back to 1975. Sources of data and information include journals, books, conference proceedings, observatory reports and newsletters, some NASA reports, and PhD theses.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  <search_hints>Keyword search results may contain records which iclude part of the searched keywords. Keyword search results are displayed in order of relevance (Records that include all keywords appear first). ## ##Subject searches are done in All Fields. ## ##Author searches are done on Last Name only. ## ##The Boolean operators NOT/OR are not supported. ## ##Where available, the external links display the URLs for the Abstract and the Full Text. The Abstract (where available) appears first.</search_hints>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://adsabs.harvard.edu/abstract_service.html</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

Sie umfasst derzeit die Jahrg&#xE4;nge 1985- der Druckfassung, insgesamt rund 180.000 Titel. The collection provides keyword searching of almost 281,000 pages of full-text by close to 10,000 individuals from all walks of life.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  <search_hints>Boolean OR is supported only between all fields terms. ##As this resource searches personal narratives, the narrator is searched via Title and the interviewer via Author. ##Subject and Author searches are supported but not always shown in the retrieved record. ## ##Abstracts are taken from the interviews themselves and not from the metadata.</search_hints>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://asp6new.alexanderstreet.com/orhi/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

It spans more than four centuries and 15 languages and includes over two million pages in full image. Users can trace the evolution of feminism within a single country, as well as the impact of that country's feminist movement on other countries and their movements. The Gerritsen Collection also provides immediate access to many primary sources from around the world that were previously available only in a limited number of rare book rooms.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  <search_hints>ISSN/ISBN and Subject searches are not supported.</search_hints>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://gerritsen.chadwyck.com/home.do</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  <link_publisher>http://www.il.proquest.com/</link_publisher>\n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

Library</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <searchable>1</searchable>\n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n Register Library contains the Federal Register from its inception in 1936, the Code of Federal Regulations, the Administrative Procedure Act, Code of Emergency Federal Regulations, the U.S. Government Manual and the Weekly Compilation of Presidential Documents.####The Federal Register is the main source for the United States federal government agencies' proposed new rules, final rules, changes to existing rules and notices of Federal agencies and organizations, as well as executive orders and other presidential documents.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  <search_hints>NOT Boolean searches are not supported. ##All Fields searches are done in full text. ##Title searches are done in Federal Register volume title. ##Subject searches are done in section description. ##Author searches are done in section title. ##ISSNs, ISBNs are not indexed in this database. ##Record structure is inconsistent in the naive interface, so data sometimes appears in the wrong field. ##The abstract field sometimes contains year data.</search_hints>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n <?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04185</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Code of Federal Regulations (HEIN)</title_full>\n  <title_display>Code of Federal Regulations</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <searchable>1</searchable>\n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  <creator>US Office of the Federal Register</creator>\n  <publisher>Hein Online</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) is the codification of the general and permanent rules and regulations (sometimes called administrative law) published in the Federal Register by the executive departments and agencies of the Federal Government of the United States. ##The CFR is published by the Office of the Federal Register, an agency of the National Archives and Records Administration.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  <search_hints>All Fields searches are done in full text. ##Title searches are done in title description. ##Subject sarches are done in part description. ##ISSN, ISBN and Author searches are not supported. ##NOT Boolean searches are not supported.</search_hints>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.heinonline.org/HOL/Index?collection=cfr&amp;set_as_cursor=clear</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

Material is published with an emphasis on internal medicine and specialty areas including allergy/immunology, cardiology, endocrinology, gastroenterology, hematology, kidney disease, oncology, pulmonary disease, rheumatology, HIV, and infectious diseases.####NEJM Online contains both the current issue and an online archive that can be accessed through browsing, advanced searching, or collections by disease or topic.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  <search_hints>The possible search options are: ##All fields ##Title ##Author ##Subject ##All fields/Title/Author/Subject AND Year ##All fields/Title/Subject AND Author (Author term must be second) ##All fields AND/NOT Title/Subject (Title/Subject term must be second) ##All fields AND/NOT All fields ##Title AND/NOT Title ##Subject AND/NOT Subject ##Author AND/NOT Author ## ##Author search in the format LAST, FIRST and LAST, F? might give irrelevant results. ##Phrase search is supported only in All fields search terms.</search_hints>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>E-Journal</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://content.nejm.org/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04204</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>U.S. Attorney General &amp; Department of Justice Collection (HEIN)</title_full>\n  <title_display>U.S. Attorney General &amp; Department of Justice Collection</title_display>\n  \n  <title_alternate>US Attorney General Opinions</title_alternate>\n  <title_alternate>United States Attorney General</title_alternate>\n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <searchable>1</searchable>\n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  <creator>US Office of the Attorney General</creator>\n  <publisher>Hein Online</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The Judiciary Act of 1789 created the Office of the Attorney General, which evolved over the years into the head of the Department of Justice and chief law enforcement officer of the Federal Government. The Attorney General represents the United States in legal matters generally and gives advice and opinions to the President and to the heads of the executive departments of the Government.####This library contains: the Attorney General's Committee on Administrative Procedure (1940-41); the Attorney General's National Committee to Study Antitrust Laws (1955); the Attorney General's Survey of Release Procedures (1939-40); the Attorney General Annual Reports (1870-2005); the Digest of the Published Opinions of the Attorney General and of the Leading Decisions of the Federal Courts with Reference to International Laws, Treaties and Kindred Subjects (1877); the Official Opinions of the Attorney General of the United States (1791-1982); and the Opinions of the Office of Legal Counsel of the United States Department of Justice (1977-1996).</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  <search_hints>Only All Fields, Title and Author searches are supported. ## ##All Fields searches are done in full text. ## ##Truncation and Middle initial are not supported in Author searches. ## ##Presented fields are sometimes inconsistent due to inconsistent order of fields in native records.</search_hints>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.heinonline.org/HOL/Index?collection=agopinions&amp;set_as_cursor=clear</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU04350</metalib_id><title_full>AP Images</title_full><title_display>Associated Press Images Collection</title_display><publisher>Associated Press (AP)</publisher><description>The AP Images database provides a sensory journey of photographs, audio sound bites, graphics and text spanning over 160 years of history. Student comprehension and recall skills will improve with visually stimulating imagery meant for use in research papers, theses, reports and PowerPoint presentations. From simple keyword searching to more complex searches such as concept, color, and category, users will enhance their research by accessing over one million photographs dating back to 1826 and as current as a few moments ago, tens of thousands of graphics, more than 4,500 hours of audio files dating from the 1920's, and news stories dating from 1997. Teachers will benefit from the correlation of the Archive to State Learning Standards as well as the National Standards for Learning.</description><link_native_home>http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?authtype=ip,uid&amp;profile=ehost&amp;defaultdb=apg</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription><title_alternate>AccuNet/AP Multimedia Archive</title_alternate></database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04359</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>African Journals Online (AJOL)</title_full>\n  <title_display>African Journals Online (AJOL)</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  \n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>AJOL is a database of African-published journals, publishing in a range of academic disciplines. The objective of AJOL is to give greater visibility to the participating journals, and to the research they convey. &lt;P&gt; AJOL includes information about each participating journal, including aims and scope, contact details and general information. It also provides Tables of contents and abstracts (where available) for all articles published within these journals. Some full text articles are also available.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.ajol.info/index.php?z=z&amp;order=c#12</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 26399</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04361</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>African-American Almanac</title_full>\n  <title_display>African-American Almanac</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>Gale</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The African American Almanac provides historical and current information on African American history, society, and culture in 28 topical chapters (e.g., African American Firsts, Politics, Family &amp; Health). It also includes a chronology, a chapter of important primary documents, directories of organizations and businesses, a bibliography of recently-published works, annotated lists of crucial court cases, a filmography, hundreds of brief biographies, and more than 650 photographs, illustrations, maps, and statistical charts located within the most appropriate text.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://galenet.galegroup.com/servlet/eBooks?ste=22&amp;docNum=CX3410499999</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 25961</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04383</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>ARTFL</title_full>\n  <title_display>ARTFL</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>ARTFL &amp; University of Chicago</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>At present the corpus consists of nearly 2000 texts, ranging from classic works of French literature to various kinds of non-fiction prose and technical writing. The eighteenth, nineteenth and twentieth centuries are about equally represented, with a smaller selection of seventeenth century texts as well as some medieval and Renaissance texts. We have also recently added a Proven&#xE7;al database that includes 38 texts in their original spellings. Genres include novels, verse, theater, journalism, essays, correspondence, and treatises. Subjects include literary criticism, biology, history, economics, and philosophy. In most cases standard scholarly editions were used in converting the text into machine-readable form, and the data contain page references to these editions.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.lib.uchicago.edu/efts/ARTFL/databases/TLF07/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 4699</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU04418</metalib_id><title_full>Business Plan Handbooks</title_full><title_display>Business Plan Handbooks</title_display><publisher>Gale</publisher><description>This annual Gale series of electronic books, from 1993 to present, is intended to help entrepreneurs who seek assistance on creating business plans for their small businesses. The resource mainly provides sample business plans from actual businesses in the manufacturing, retail and service industries. Names and addresses, and sometimes product names, have been changed to maintain confidentiality. Entries cover a wide range of business types, from bakeries to manufacturers of fiber optics or from electronic publishing to disposable medical supplies. Users can search by edition/date, keyword, title, subject, and other parameters. A help feature provides numerous tips on search optimization. Additional features include: a directory of the 750 Small Business Development Centers in the United States that provide support and advice; a glossary of small business terms; and a bibliography for further reading.</description><link_native_home>http://go.galegroup.com/ps/aboutSeries.do?inPS=true&amp;prodId=GVRL&amp;userGroupName=balt85423&amp;seriesId=0PHU</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription></database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04439</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Library of Latin Texts - Series A (LLT-A)</title_full>\n  <title_display>Library of Latin Texts - Series A (LLT-A)</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>Brepols</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>Formerly known as CETEDOC, this database for Latin texts, contains texts from the beginning of Latin literature  through to the texts of the Second Vatican Council (1962-1965). It covers all the works from the classical period, the most important patristic works, a very extensive corpus of Medieval Latin literature and works of later Latin, including texts from the Reformation and Counter-Reformation. The complete works of writers such as Cicero, Virgil, Augustine, Jerome, Gregory the Great, Anselm of Canterbury, Bernard of Clairvaux and Thomas Kempis are included. The texts have been taken from the Corpus Christianorum and Teubner series and other editions.    The contents of the Library of Latin Texts are listed in the Guide, linked in the navigational column on the left side of the LLT web page.  Adobe Reader 7.0 is needed to view the Guide.  A user can select a word found in a text of the Library of Latin Texts and by clicking on the button labeled "Consult DLD" find entries for the word in the constituent dictionaries of the Database of Latin Dictionaries. Likewise, a live link from the DLD back to the Library of Latin Texts enables the user who has conducted a search on a word in a dictionary within DLD to export this word automatically to its sister-database and thereby identify actual occurrences of the particular word in the Library of Latin Texts in context.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://clt.brepolis.net/llta/pages/Search.aspx</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 26353</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU04458</metalib_id><title_full>&#xC9;tudes critiques du 19&#xE8;me si&#xE8;cleis</title_full><title_display>&#xC9;tudes critiques du 19&#xE8;me si&#xE8;cleis</title_display><publisher>ARTFL</publisher><description>The learned volumes, serialized articles, prefaces, and manifestos collected in &#xC9;tudes critiques du 19&#xE8;me si&#xE8;cleis reproduce the great literary debates which animated the 19th century. One hundred fifteen works and collections, thirty-three authors, and one hundred thousand pages of analysis allow the user to investigate the polemics and controversies in depth. The collection traverses the entire 19th century, beginning with Laharpe, who taught and provided a point of reference for many of his successors, and ending with Apollinaire and Proust, both highly prolific and distinctive critics. Made available by the ARTFL Project.</description><link_native_home>https://artflsrv03.uchicago.edu/philologic4/etudescritiques/</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription></database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU04460</metalib_id><title_full>CRSP U.S. Treasury (JHU faculty and graduate students for academic research only)</title_full><title_display>CRSP U.S. Treasury (JHU faculty and graduate students for academic research only)</title_display><description>The CRSP US Treasury database includes over 1.6 million end-of-day price observations for 3,350 US Treasury bills, notes, and bonds and over 101,500 prices for 5,300 month-end issues. Coverage begins in 1925 for month-end data and in 1961 for daily data. The CRSP US Treasury and Inflation Series contain returns and index levels on the US Government Bond Fixed Term Index Series, and the Risk Free Rates File.  The Wharton Research Data Service is a tool that provides web-based access to this database. WRDS is only available to JHU faculty and graduate students who have approved WRDS accounts for their academic research. Please allow up to 48 hours for the registration and approval process. Faculty may request a shared &#x201C;class&#x201D; account for a course.</description><link_native_home>https://wrds-web.wharton.upenn.edu/wrds/</link_native_home><proxy>0</proxy><subscription>1</subscription></database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04464</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Database of Latin Dictionaries</title_full>\n  <title_display>Database of Latin Dictionaries</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>Brepols</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The aim of the database is not only to integrate different types of Latin dictionaries, whether modern, medieval or early-modern, but also to build in links between these different tools. Where the dictionaries provide Latin terms and vernacular equivalents or explanations (whether in contemporary or historic forms of English, French or German), searches will be possible on both the Latin lemmata and the English, French or German lemmata. This database will provide an unsurpassed tool since all Latin word-forms that appear concretely in texts will have a link to entries in relevant dictionaries and from there the user can go and read the selected dictionary entry.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://clt.brepolis.net/dld/pages/AdvancedSearch.aspx</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 26499</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

Information about each data system is provided, including links to relevant websites. &lt;p&gt; The Directory was designed to include data resources with the potential for use by a wide audience. <?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04477</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>DIRLINE directory of health organizations / National Library of Medicine.</title_full>\n  <title_display>DIRLINE directory of health organizations / National Library of Medicine.</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>National Library of Medicine</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>DIRLINE is a directory of sources to get information about health and biomedicine. These information resources fall into many categories including federal, state, and local government agencies; information and referral centers; professional societies; self-help groups and voluntary associations; academic and research institutions and their programs; information systems; and research facilities. &lt;p&gt; Topics include HIV/AIDS, maternal and child health, most diseases and conditions including genetic and other rare diseases, health services research and technology assessment. &lt;p&gt; DIRLINE is maintained by the National Institutes of Health.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://dirline.nlm.nih.gov/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 25918</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

Many are ephemeral, lasting only for a handful of issues, others run for several years. Topics covered are extremely wide-ranging and include: colonial life; provincial and rural affairs; the French and American revolutions; reviews of literature and fashion throughout Europe; political debates; and London coffee house gossip and discussion.</description><link_native_home>http://www.18thcjournals.amdigital.co.uk/</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription><title_alternate>18th Century Journals</title_alternate></database>\n

Currently, it contains about 413,000 items. When complete, it will contain virtually all English items printed between 1473 and 1800. Appended to each record is a list of libraries which have reported holding a copy of the item described. Updated daily. The GEM gallery already includes 6,600 fully treated objects from 10 European collections, with extensive documentation and colour photography. The number of objects displayed and the number of participating museums is increasing every year.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.globalegyptianmuseum.org/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 26335</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU04551</metalib_id><title_full>Global Insight</title_full><title_display>IHS Global Insight (JHU faculty and graduate students for academic research only)</title_display><description>IHS Global Insight provides news, economic indicators, and a vast array of recent and historical business and economics data series for the domestic and international markets. Frequency (daily, weekly, monthly, annual) and depth will vary by series. On the homepage, click on &#x201C;Data Insight-Web&#x201D; to browse and select by series and geography. <?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04553</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Goethes Werke</title_full>\n  <title_display>Goethes Werke</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>Chadwyck</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>Goethes Werke im WWW umfa&#xDF;t den vollst&#xE4;ndigen Text der 143 B&#xE4;nde der Weimarer Ausgabe.    Jedes Wort der literarischen und wissenschaftlichen Werke Goethes, seiner Tageb&#xFC;cher und seiner Briefe ist in der Weimarer Ausgabe enthalten. &#xDC;berdies werden s&#xE4;mtliche Abbildungen der Weimarer Ausgabe eingescannt. Die Datenbank umfa&#xDF;t den gesamten wissenschaftlichen Apparat einschlie&#xDF;lich der Lesarten, Paralipomena sowie Sach- und Personenregister.    Goethes Werke im WWW enth&#xE4;lt au&#xDF;erdem Goethes Gespr&#xE4;che, herausgegeben von Woldemar Freiherr von Biedermann, Leipzig, 1889-96, und Goethes Werke, Nachtr&#xE4;ge zur Weimarer Ausgabe, herausgegeben von Paul Raabe, M&#xFC;nchen, 1990. Die Ausgabe der Gespr&#xE4;che von Woldemar Freiherr von Biedermann wurde ausgew&#xE4;hlt, weil sie sich mehr als andere Ausgaben auf Goethes gesprochene Worte st&#xFC;tzt. In den Nachtr&#xE4;gen sind alle die Briefe Goethes gesammelt, die nach Fertigstellung der Weimarer Ausgabe entdeckt wurden. Hiermit liegt die vollst&#xE4;ndigste bestehende Sammlung der Briefe Goethes vor.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://goethe.chadwyck.com/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 12376</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

Supported by the Andrew W. Mellon foundation, the titles are selected and made available through a collaborative effort between the American Historical Association and Columbia University Press. Books selected for inclusion have undergone a rigorous academic review process and represent a range of subjects. The works include extensive documentation, hyperlinks to supplementary literature, images, music, video, and links to related web sites.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.gutenberg-e.org/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 14001</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04563</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Hazardous Substances Data Bank (HSDB)</title_full>\n  <title_display>Hazardous Substances Data Bank (HSDB)</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  \n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>HSDB (Hazardous Substances Data Bank)provides the toxicology of potentially hazardous chemicals. &lt;p&gt; It includes information on human health effects, industrial hygiene, emergency handling procedures, environmental fate, regulatory requirements, emergency medical treatment, animal toxicity studies, metabolism/pharmacokinetics, pharmacology, chemical/physical properties, safety and handling, occupational exposure standards, manufacturing information, and related areas. &lt;p&gt; HSDB is peer-reviewed, and organized into individual chemical records. HSDB is produced by the National Library of Medicine and accessed through TOXNET.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://toxnet.nlm.nih.gov/cgi-bin/sis/htmlgen?HSDB</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 26234</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU04577</metalib_id><title_full>Index of Medieval Art</title_full><title_display>Index of Medieval Art</title_display><description>The Index of Christian Art catalogs and provides related scholarship to works of art produced without geographical limitations from early apostolic times up to A.D. 1400, extended in the case of the Morgan and Princeton Library projects to include manuscript holdings up to the end of the sixteenth century. The database contains three main authority files: Work of Art records, Subject records (the classification terms used to index the works of art) and Bibliographic records (citations that support the above two files). These three files may be used independently or in combination.</description><link_native_home>https://ima.princeton.edu/</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription></database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU04582</metalib_id><title_full>International Medieval Bibliography (IMB)</title_full><title_display>International Medieval Bibliography (IMB)</title_display><publisher>Brepols</publisher><description>An interdisciplinary bibligraphy of the Middle Ages that covers Europe, the Middle East, and North Africa during the period 400-1500. Coverage began in 1967 and includes over 4500 periodicals, 5000+ miscellany volumes (conference proceedings, essay collections, Festschriften, and exhibition catalogues.) Does not include book reviews. Search screen is fully integrated with the Bibliographie de Civilisation M&#xE9;di&#xE9;vale Online which covers monographs.</description><link_native_home>http://cpps.brepolis.net/bmb/search.cfm</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription></database>\n

You can see the most frequently cited journals in a field, highest-impact journals in a field, "hottest" journals in a field, leading journals in a field, and the most published articles in a field.</description><link_native_home>https://jcr.clarivate.com</link_native_home><proxy>1</proxy><subscription>1</subscription><title_alternate>InCites</title_alternate></database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04596</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Levy Sheet Music Collection</title_full>\n  <title_display>Levy Sheet Music Collection</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>1</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <proxy>0</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  \n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The Lester S. Levy Collection of Sheet Music is part of Special Collections at the Milton S. Eisenhower Library of The Johns Hopkins University. It contains over 29,000 pieces of music and focuses on popular American music spanning the period 1780 to 1960. All pieces of the collection are indexed on this site and a search will retrieve a catalog description of the pieces. An image of the cover and each page of music will also be retrieved if the music was published before 1923 and is in the public domain.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://levysheetmusic.mse.jhu.edu/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 26215</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

The English collection includes these databases: Locke, Berkeley, Hume; Hobbes; The Utilitarians: Bentham, Mill, Sidgwick; Economics: Smith, Ricardo, Mill; Peirce; Political Philosophy: Hobbes, Locke, Hume, Paine, Bentham, Mill, Constitution of the United States. <?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04644</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Perseus Digital Library</title_full>\n  <title_display>Perseus Digital Library</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  \n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>PERSEUS is a multimedia resource that provides an overview of the ancient Greek world. The database concentrates on five areas: a. Historical Overview -- historical essays on Ancient Greece organized by political and cultural eras b. Tools and References -- Greek encyclopedia and dictionary, bibliography for Greek texts and references, and word and subject search functions c. Art and archaeology -- descriptions and photographs of archeological sites, sculpture, coins and other art d. Atlas -- general and regional maps of Greece e. <?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04667</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Romanciers Realistes et Naturalistes</title_full>\n  <title_display>Romanciers Realistes et Naturalistes</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>ARTFL</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>Romanciers r&#xE9;alistes et naturalistes: 1820-1910 presents nearly three hundred entire works of 19th century France's great novelists, such as Balzac and Zola, as well as works by lesser known novelists, such as Duranty and Cladel. By uniting widely read texts with forgotten texts, this database allows the user to recapture a textual dialogue lost to history and see how these authors read and responded to one another in their writing. Searching is available using the PhiloLogic or Trevi interfaces. Made available by the ARTFL Project.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.lib.uchicago.edu/efts/ARTFL/databases/bibliopolis/rrn/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 13664</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

Originally created by Historical Data Systems, Inc., the database contains indexed, searchable information on over 4 million soldiers and thousands of battles, together with 15,000 photographs. NTRS provides access to approximately 500K aerospace related citations, 90K full-text online documents, and 111K images and videos. NTRS numbers continues to grow over time as new scientific and technical information (STI) is created or funded by NASA. The type of information found in NTRS include: conference papers, images, journal articles, photos, meeting papers, movies, patents, research reports, and technical videos.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://ntrs.nasa.gov/search.jsp</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU04947</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Catalog of U.S. government publications</title_full>\n  <title_display>Catalog of U.S. government publications</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>Access.gpo</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>This catalog (CGP) is a comprehensive finding tool for the publications of all 3 branches of the Federal Government dating from 1976 to the present. Originally, the CGP was the online counterpart to the Monthly Catalog of United States Government Publications (first published in 1895 and ceased in 2004). Whenever possible, there are direct links to the online versions of the documents. A project is underway to include cataloging for earlier publications. As of 2012 the CGP includes over 125,000 pre-1976 titles.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://purl.access.gpo.gov/GPO/LPS844</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 16158</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU05003</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Poole's Index to Periodical Literature (C19)</title_full>\n  <title_display>Poole's Index to Periodical Literature</title_display>\n  \n  <title_alternate>Poole ; C19 The 19th Century Index</title_alternate>\n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>Chadwyck-Healey &amp; ProQuest</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>Poole's Index to Periodical Literature is the first and only systematic article level index to the subject matter of 19th century periodicals. Originally published in six volumes between 1882 and 1908, the Index began in 1848 as the project of Yale student, William Frederick Poole. Poole observed that libraries hold collections of periodicals which receive little use because their content is not known. Through the application of subject indexing, Poole was able to dramatically increase access to periodical literature, greatly facilitating the research process. In 1876, Poole was approached by the American Library Association, and persuaded to produce a new edition of his index, with the assistance William Fletcher, Librarian of Amherst College, and the library community in North America and the UK. When the final volume was released in 1908, the Index had covered 482,000 articles and 378,000 subjects in 12,241 volumes of 479 British and American periodicals for the years 1802-1906.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://c19index.chadwyck.com/gotoSearchCollections.do?initialise=pooles</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  <local_1>hermesID: 25950</local_1>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU05069</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Social and Cultural History: Letters and Diaries Online (ASP)</title_full>\n  <title_display>Social and Cultural History: Letters and Diaries Online</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  <creator>Alexander Street Press</creator>\n  <publisher>Alexander Street Press</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The most comprehensive archive of social memory yet created, Social and Cultural History: Letters and Diaries Online allows students, scholars, and online researchers to experience the past through thousands of private writings and personal narratives. The resource is a unique forum that brings together the voices of ordinary men and women from all walks of life with the personal accounts of well-known historical figures. In their own words, people from diverse ethnic and social groups bring vividly to life hundreds of years of history through their perspectives on life, love, faith, politics, business, and countless personal events.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://asp6new.alexanderstreet.com/ladd/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

The series, produced by the State Department's Office of the Historian, comprises more than 350 volumes of resourceful historical information. The series began in 1861 during Abraham Lincoln's administration and continues through the administration of Richard Nixon in 1975.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.heinonline.org/HOL/Index?collection=forrel&amp;set_as_cursor=clear</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU05087</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>FRANTEXT Database (ARTFL)</title_full>\n  <title_display>FRANTEXT Database</title_display>\n  \n  <title_alternate>Tr&#xE9;sor de la Langue Fran&#xE7;aise</title_alternate>\n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>ARTFL</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The ARTFL implementation of the FRANTEXT database (formerly the Tr&#xE9;sor de la Langue Fran&#xE7;aise) consists of over 2600 texts, ranging from classic works of French literature to various kinds of non-fiction prose and technical writing. The eighteenth, nineteenth and twentieth centuries are about equally represented, with a smaller selection of seventeenth century texts as well as some medieval and Renaissance texts. Genres include novels, poetry, theater, journalism, essays, correspondence, and treatises. Subjects include literary criticism, biology, history, economics, and philosophy.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.lib.uchicago.edu/efts/ARTFL/databases/TLF07/frantext.search.html</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU05090</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Ecrits sur l'art de Diderot &#xE0; Proust</title_full>\n  <title_display>Ecrits sur l'art de Diderot &#xE0; Proust</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>ARTFL</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>&#xC9;crits sur l'art de Diderot &#xE0; Proust brings together a wide range of writings on art: aesthetics, philosophy, art history, and texts by painters and writers. This diversity of writings allows the user to investigate the links between painting and writing from different points of view. The texts here also span a period of nearly two centuries, beginning with P&#xE8;re Andr&#xE9;&#x2019;s L&#x2019;Essai sur le beau from 1741, six years before the first salon, and ending with the last volume of Proust&#x2019;s &#xC0; la recherche du temps perdu from 1927. Made available by the ARTFL Project.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.lib.uchicago.edu/efts/ARTFL/databases/bibliopolis/art/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU05094</metalib_id><title_full>Current Digest of the Post-Soviet Press (East View)</title_full><title_display>Current Digest of the Russian Press</title_display><creator>East View</creator><publisher>East View</publisher><description>The Current Digest of the Russian Press was founded in 1949.  Each week it presents a selection of Russian-language press materials, carefully translated into English.  The translations are intended for use in teaching and research.  They are therefore presented as documentary materials without elaboration or comment, and state the opinions and views of the original authors, not of the publisher of the journal.</description><search_hints>NOT Boolean operator is not supported. The purpose of this database is to provide a one-stop source of statistics and indicators disaggregated by gender. Gender Statistics compiles data on key gender topics from a variety of national and international sources. These sources include national statistics, United Nations databases, and World Bank-conducted or funded surveys.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://databank.worldbank.org/ddp/home.do?Step=12&amp;id=4&amp;CNO=283</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU05186</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Federal Justice Statistics Resource Center</title_full>\n  <title_display>Federal Justice Statistics Resource Center</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>1</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <proxy>0</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>US Department of Justice, Bureau of Justice Statistics</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The Bureau of Justice Statistics (BJS), through its Federal Justice Statistics Resource Center (FJSRC), compiles comprehensive information describing suspects and defendants processed in the Federal criminal justice system. The goal of FJSRC is to provide uniform case processing statistics across all stages of the Federal criminal justice system. Using data obtained from Federal agencies, FJSRC compiles comprehensive information that describes person-cases processed through the system.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Subject Gateway</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://fjsrc.urban.org/index.cfm</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU05223</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>National Practitioner Data Bank</title_full>\n  <title_display>National Practitioner Data Bank</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>1</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <proxy>0</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The NPDB is primarily an alert or flagging system intended to facilitate a comprehensive review of health care practitioners' professional credentials. The information contained in the NPDB is intended to direct discrete inquiry into, and scrutiny of, specific areas of a practitioner's licensure, professional society memberships, medical malpractice payment history, and record of clinical privileges. The information contained in the NPDB should be considered together with other relevant data in evaluating a practitioner's credentials; it is intended to augment, not replace, traditional forms of credentials review.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Subject Gateway</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.npdb-hipdb.hrsa.gov/resources/aboutResources.jsp</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU05228</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Film Literature Index</title_full>\n  <title_display>Film Literature Index</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>1</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <proxy>0</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>Indiana University. Film &amp; Television Documentation Center.</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>In 1973, the Film and Television Documentation Center at the State University of New York (SUNY) published the Film Literature Index, the first periodical index devoted to the literature of film designed for the scholar, the student, and the general reader. The index has since expanded coverage to include television and video productions. The Film Literature Index annually indexes 150 film and television periodicals from 30 countries cover-to-cover and 200 other periodicals selectively for articles on film and television. The periodicals range from the scholarly and critical to the popular. &lt;strong&gt;The FLI Online contains citations from 1976 to 2001.&lt;/strong&gt;</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://webapp1.dlib.indiana.edu/fli/advancedSearch.jsp</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU05267</metalib_id><title_full>Siku Quanshu</title_full><title_display>Siku Quanshu Online</title_display><publisher>Dizhi Publishing Company</publisher><description>The online edition of Siku Quanshu spans five thousand years of Chinese history, geography, politics, economics, science, technology, philosophy, and close to 3,500 works with a total of more than 36,000 volumes. The compilation contains large numbers of rare books and manuscripts and is an important tool for East Asian Studies.&#xD;\nAccess to Siku Quanshu Online is restricted to Johns Hopkins University IP addresses.&#xD;\nBecause the database contains archaic Chinese characters that are not part of the Unicode standard,  there is no direct URL that references the database in an internet browser. Instead, the user needs to download a special browser software from the publisher. Once the software is installed, the database can be launched from the Programs menu on the user&#x2019;s computer and then accessed by clicking on 'IP Login'.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nCurrently, the database publisher cannot provide remote access support. The user needs to be on campus to access the database, either using their own computer with installed special browser software or the CJK workstation in the AV Department on the A level of the MSE Library. &#xD;\n&#xD;\nFor the browser software download, click the SIku Quanshu Online link or go to http://www.eastview.com/Online/SikuDownload.</description><link_native_home>http://www.eastview.com/Online/SikuDownload</link_native_home><proxy>0</proxy><subscription>1</subscription></database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database><metalib_id>JHU05268</metalib_id><title_full>Healthcare Cost &amp; Utilization Project</title_full><title_display>Healthcare Cost &amp; Utilization Project</title_display><publisher>Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ)</publisher><description>The Healthcare Cost and Utilization Project (HCUP, pronounced "H-Cup") is a family of health care databases and related software tools and products developed through a Federal-State-Industry partnership and sponsored by the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality (AHRQ). HCUP databases bring together the data collection efforts of State data organizations, hospital associations, private data organizations, and the Federal government to create a national information resource of patient-level health care data (HCUP Partners). HCUP includes the largest collection of longitudinal hospital care data in the United States, with all-payer, encounter-level information beginning in 1988. These databases enable research on a broad range of health policy issues, including cost and quality of health services, medical practice patterns, access to health care programs, and outcomes of treatments at the national, State, and local market levels.</description><link_native_home>http://hcupnet.ahrq.gov/</link_native_home><proxy>0</proxy><subscription>0</subscription><title_alternate>HCUPNet</title_alternate></database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU05270</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Palmer's Index to the Times 1790-1905 (PQ)</title_full>\n  <title_display>Palmer's Index to the Times 1790-1905</title_display>\n  \n  <title_alternate>part of the Historical Newspapers database</title_alternate>\n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>Chadwyck-Healey &amp; ProQuest</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>London bookseller Samuel Palmer published the first volume of his index to The Times&#xAE; in 1867. Going back to October 1790, then publishing quarterly updates to December 1905, Palmer and his successors indexed articles in every issue, creating a resource that has long been recognised as an essential companion to the newspaper itself. Palmer's Index is the standard reference work for any library holding the newspaper in print or on microfilm. The online version cumulates 450 quarterly issues containing 3.7 million references on 28,000 pages.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Newspaper</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://historynews.chadwyck.com/noframes19/search</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU05271</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>Official Index to the Times 1906-1980 (PQ)</title_full>\n  <title_display>Official Index to the Times 1906-1980</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>0</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <subscription>1</subscription>\n  <proxy>1</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>Chadwyck-Healey &amp; ProQuest</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The Official Index to the Times provides indexing for the Times of London for 1906-1980. Can be used together with Palmer's Index to the Times (of London), 1790-1905. See also Times Digital Archive.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Newspaper</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://historynews.chadwyck.com/noframes/search</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n

(SIRI)</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The objective of the SIRI MSDS archive is to make critical safety information as immediately and universally accessible as possible. Electronic archives provide a single source where any MSDS can be instantly located; it is essential that information from all manufacturers be accessible in a single index because it is often difficult in an emergency to identify the manufacturer.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://hazard.com/msds/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU05315</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>ThermoDex : An Index of Selected Thermodynamic and Physical Property Resources</title_full>\n  <title_display>ThermoDex : An Index of Selected Thermodynamic and Physical Property Resources</title_display>\n  \n  <title_alternate>Thermo Dex</title_alternate>\n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>1</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <proxy>0</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>University of Texas Libraries</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>ThermoDex contains annotated bibliographic records that describe compilations of thermodynamic and physical property data for chemical compounds and other substances. Most are printed books; a few are freely available Web-based databases. ThermoDex is a "finding aid" designed to save you time in searching through numerous handbooks you might have in your library or lab. It enables you to enter both a type of compound and a property, and it returns a list of handbooks that might contain these data. The actual data are not reproduced in ThermoDex.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.lib.utexas.edu/thermodex/</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n
<?xml version="1.0"?>\n<database>\n  <metalib_id>JHU05317</metalib_id>\n<!--title-->\n  <title_full>NCBI Structure Group</title_full>\n  <title_display>NCBI Structure Group</title_display>\n  \n<!--access-->\n  <institute>JHU</institute>\n  <guest_access>1</guest_access>\n  \n  \n  <proxy>0</proxy>\n  <active>ACTIVE</active>\n  \n  \n  \n<!--creator-->\n  \n  <publisher>National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI)</publisher>\n  \n<!--notes-->\n  <description>The NCBI Structure Group maintains: MMDB, a database of macromolecular 3D structures, as well as tools for their visualization and comparative analysis. MMDB, the Molecular Modelling DataBase, contains experimentally determined biopolymer structures obtained from the Protein Data Bank (PDB); PubVast, a database of structure-structure alignments; PubChem, a database of small molecules, which provides information on their biological activities; and CDD, the Conserved Domain Database, a protein annotation resource, which consists of a collection of well-annotated multiple sequence alignment models for ancient domains and full-length proteins.</description>\n  \n  \n  <cjk_language>lat</cjk_language>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--subjects-->\n  <type>Index</type>\n<!--library / librarian-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--links-->\n  <link_native_home>http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Structure/index.shtml</link_native_home>\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--local-->\n  \n  \n  \n  \n  \n<!--verde-->\n  \n  \n</database>\n
